Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Arenicin-2 (Ar-2, UCSS1a; 1S=S, Arg-rich; natural AMPs; marine polychaeta, annelid worm, invertebrates, animals; BBBh2o; BBMm; Derivative: Ar-2-Abu)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: active against L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 0.6 ug/ml), Gram-negative E. coli ML-35p (MIC 4 ug/ml) and fungi C. albicans 820 (MIC 4.5 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: activity against E. coli was not influenced by 100 mM NaCl, but activity against C. albicans was.Structure: A beta hairpin structure, see Biochem Biophys. Res. Commun 2007; 360: 156-162.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.SAR: Replacement of C3 and C20 with Abu disrupted activity against M. abscessus (Casanova et al., 2024).Updated Feb2014;11/2018; 7/2021; 6/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Ovchinnikova et al. Kokryakov VN2004
Literature Information.Title: Purification and primary structure of two isoforms of arenicin, a novel antimicrobial peptide from marine polychaeta, Arenicola marina
